subject: Investing
title: Media Influence on Market Sentiment
description: One-minute skill: Media Influence on Market Sentiment.

hook.text: Financial headlines were bearish 80% of the time in 2009â€”the single best year to buy stocks in a decade.

buildup.text: Financial media profits from attention. Fear and drama drive clicks more than calm analysis.

discovery.text: Negative headlines outnumber positive ones 3-to-1, even during bull markets.

twist.text: Investors who reduced news consumption to weekly summaries outperformed daily news watchers.

climax.text: Consume financial media for context, never for trading signals. The incentives don't align.

punchline.text: News is entertainment with a financial label. Don't confuse it with a strategy.

quiz.question: Why do negative financial headlines outnumber positive ones?
options: Fear and drama drive more clicks
